Package net.evmodder.DropHeads

Class DropChanceAPI

java.lang.Object
net.evmodder.DropHeads.DropChanceAPI
public final class DropChanceAPI extends Object
Public API hook for getting head drop chance data loaded from DropHeads configs Warning: This class is still in BETA and some functions may change (or disappear!) in future releases

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    announceHeadDrop(TellrawUtils.Component message, Entity entity, Entity killer, Event evt)
    Send a head drop announcement message for an entity with recipients are based on:
    * The AnnounceMode setting for the entity's type
    * The permissions of the killer
    * The pet-owner of the entity, if exists
    * Specific broadcast settings from the DropHeads config
    void

  • Method Details

    • getDefaultDropChance

      public double getDefaultDropChance()
      Get the default head drop chance for an entity when a drop chance chance is specified in the config
      Returns:
      The default drop chance [0, 1]

    • getRequiredWeapons

      public Set<Material> getRequiredWeapons()
      Get the set of weapons that are allowed to cause a head drop; will be null if no specific weapon(s) are required
      Returns:
      An immutable set of Material types, or null

    • getRawDropChance

      public double getRawDropChance(String textureKey)
      Get the raw drop chance (ignore all modifiers) of a head for a specific texture key.
      Parameters:
      textureKey - The target texture key
      Returns:
      The drop chance [0, 1]

    • getRawDropChance

      public double getRawDropChance(Entity entity)
      Get the raw drop chance (ignore all modifiers) of a head for a specific entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The target entity
      Returns:
      The drop chance [0, 1]

    • getRawDropChances

      public Map<EntityType,Double> getRawDropChances()
      Get a map of all configured drop chances.
      Returns:
      An immutable map (EntityType => drop chance)

    • getLootingAdd

      public double getLootingAdd()
      Get the percent chance added to the drop chance (per looting level)
      Returns:
      The drop chance increase amount

    • getLootingMult

      public double getLootingMult()
      Get the drop chance multiplier applied (per looting level)
      Returns:
      The drop chance modifier

    • getWeaponMult

      public double getWeaponMult(Material weapon)
      Get the drop chance multiplier applied based on Material of the weapon used
      Parameters:
      weapon - The type of weapon used
      Returns:
      The weapon-type multiplier

    • getTimeAliveMult

      public double getTimeAliveMult(Entity entity)
      Get the drop chance multiplier applied based on how many ticks an entity has been alive
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check the lifetime of
      Returns:
      The time-alive multiplier

    • getPermsBasedMult

      public double getPermsBasedMult(Permissible killer)
      Get the drop chance multipliers applied based on permissions of the killer
      Parameters:
      killer - The entity to check for drop chance multiplier permissions
      Returns:
      The aggregate multiplier from any relevent permission nodes

    • dropHeadItem

      public void dropHeadItem(ItemStack headItem, Entity entity, Entity killer, Event evt)
      Drop a head item for an entity using the appropriate DropMode setting
      Parameters:
      headItem - The head item which will be dropped
      entity - The entity from which the head item came
      killer - The entity responsible for causing the head item to drop
      evt - The Entity*Event from which this function is being called

    • getBeheadMessage

      public TellrawUtils.ListComponent getBeheadMessage(Entity entity, Entity killer, ItemStack weapon)
      Generate a behead message component
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity that was beheaded
      killer - The entity that did the beheading
      weapon - The weapon item used to do the beheading
      Returns:
      The behead message component

    • announceHeadDrop

      public void announceHeadDrop(@Nonnull TellrawUtils.Component message, Entity entity, Entity killer, Event evt)
      Send a head drop announcement message for an entity with recipients are based on:
      * The AnnounceMode setting for the entity's type
      * The permissions of the killer
      * The pet-owner of the entity, if exists
      * Specific broadcast settings from the DropHeads config
      Parameters:
      message - The behead announcement message
      entity - The entity to announce as beheaded
      killer - The entity to announce as the killer
      evt - The Entity*Event from which this function is being called

    • logHeadDrop

      public void logHeadDrop(Entity entity, Entity killer, ItemStack weapon)
      Logs a behead event to the DropHeads log file
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity that was beheaded
      killer - The entity that did the beheading
      weapon - The weapon item used to do the beheading

    • triggerHeadDropEvent

      public boolean triggerHeadDropEvent(Entity entity, Entity killer, Event evt, ItemStack weapon, TellrawUtils.Component beheadMessage)
      Attempt to drop a head item for an Entity with a custom behead message
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity for which to to create a head
      killer - The entity which did the killing, or null
      evt - The Entity*Event from which this function is being called
      weapon - The weapon used to kill, or null
      beheadMessage - A custom behead message that will get broadcasted
      Returns:
      Whether the head drop was completed successfully

    • triggerHeadDropEvent

      public boolean triggerHeadDropEvent(Entity entity, Entity killer, Event evt, ItemStack weapon)
      Attempt to drop a head item for an Entity with the regular behead message
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity for which to to create a head
      killer - The entity which did the killing, or null
      evt - The Entity*Event from which this function is being called
      weapon - The weapon used to kill, or null
      Returns:
      Whether the head drop was completed successfully
